elements.2211.03616_996571fa01e5d72b4ebd9aec67bde: Recently, discrete latent variable models have received a surge of interest in both Natural Language Processing (NLP) and Computer Vision (CV), attributed to their comparable performance to the continuous counterparts in representation learning, while being more interpretable in their predictions.
elements.2211.03616_b36261f5ffe278b35b1628d6c7e22: In this paper, we develop a topic-informed discrete latent variable model for semantic textual similarity, which learns a shared latent space for sentence-pair representation via vector quantization
elements.2211.03616_9b996d695a0cd74d7719540c8a76b: Compared with previous models limited to local semantic contexts, our model can explore richer semantic information via topic modeling
elements.2211.03616_911155c6d3cac93ffc0e7be591c20: We further boost the performance of semantic similarity by injecting the quantized representation into a transformer-based language model with a well-designed semantic-driven attention mechanism.
elements.2211.03616_b2d78a4da6f0a0544ed47d163f139: We demonstrate, through extensive experiments across various English language datasets, that our model is able to surpass several strong neural baselines in semantic textual similarity tasks.
elements.2211.03616_6462e0d96d677169b315c649374e3: Semantic Textual Similarity (STS), which concerns the problem of measuring and scoring the relationships or relevance of pairs of text on real-valued scales, is a fundamental task in NLP
elements.2211.03616_e2e81c0d70d43a13d5705d191f542: It has further driven many other important NLP tasks such as machine translation
elements.2211.03616_05199c0bb5f2059430b3a1dc5545d: Recently, deep neural language models have achieved state-of-the-art performance for STS
elements.2211.03616_3de84f2e9419733a998176d8ef1f7: The success of these models is attributed to their adoption of self-supervised learning on text representations, which overcomes the absence of large labeled STS data in many domains
elements.2211.03616_ce92de25b6a261777e8170d210d8c: The text representations learned by these models,
elements.2211.03616_7c23d8138f3379bedda3def316456: usually consist of continuous latent variables, and can be fed pairwise into some functions (e.g. a multi-layer perceptron) to compute their semantic similarity.
elements.2211.03616_1de20f85bcb2b12a3324b32c658d7: Compared to the continuous ones, discrete latent variables have drawn much less attention in language modeling, despite that natural languages are discrete in nature, and there is growing evidence, from several NLP tasks
elements.2211.03616_16dbbde4b7f31f822f187d6a84e57: , that they are equally good, if not more suitable, as the continuous counterparts
elements.2211.03616_80502a01277461a58fcc52ea60612: As a widely-used training technique for learning discrete latent variables, vector-quantized variational autoencoder (VQ-VAE)
elements.2211.03616_5d68ad4be2aa918f6327744124ddf: computes the values for the variables through the nearest neighbor look-up across the quantized vectors from the shared latent embedding space
elements.2211.03616_1fe2e4184f2d9fb45e84ee4b9965e: Despite its success in speech recognition and computer vision, VQ-VAE has yet to be investigated in its use and viability in general NLP tasks
elements.2211.03616_c9a4993ae24dd04c1f55406acabca: In this paper, we intend to explore the use of VQ-VAE and its generated discrete latent variables
elements.2211.03616_0077a5eb9590d6bee849c979fe7f8: Two issues need to be resolved in order for the VQ-VAE to work effectively on the STS task
elements.2211.03616_492f189e28d4da653f4d27cddbeaf: First, the codebook embeddings need to be carefully initialized to prevent the so-called codebook collapse, in which only a few of the embeddings are selected and learned by the model, causing a reduction in the representational capacity of the codebook
elements.2211.03616_450b253e6a94fee2f5e46be5c3ea2: Past research has indicated that sufficiently informed and sophisticated manipulation of the embedding initialization can mitigate this problem
elements.2211.03616_bd92099c98b0340da9c5ad068d669: A second issue is that most STS scenarios are designed to teach a language model to measure the textual similarity from a local perspective (e.g. over contexts within each sentence)
elements.2211.03616_327e2cf3fe8296ce1b9734845e48c: However, global semantics underlying a broader context has already been shown to benefit a number of NLP tasks, including language generation
elements.2211.03616_4da36429eff0b0cc363f36b5a8526: For STS, it can provide perspectives on the global correlations and dependencies among sentences, which can be leveraged to better distinguish the semantic nuances of sentence-level contexts
elements.2211.03616_777cb1cab96c390f1daf3d43a3cc3: In this paper, we propose to leverage topic modeling to tackle both issues
elements.2211.03616_6fdb9e2723ed5a03e182b03dc653b: can provide informative guidance on the initialization and the learning of VQ-VAE's codebook.
elements.2211.03616_d0ba7282ac014e38427b050930a87: Furthermore, since the discovered topics can capture global semantics (e.g., semantics as distributions over the vocabulary shared by the whole corpus), they can be used to calibrate the bias of local semantics on the measure of textual similarity.
elements.2211.03616_26487b6041c4390fe6ebee9b3119a: Our proposed topic-enhanced VQ-VAE language model features two major components to enrich the codebook representational capacity with rich contextual information.
elements.2211.03616_bbffab68e69e38d80f8158dd1e74e: One is the topic-aware sentence encoder, which computes the sentence embedding using its (local) topic distribution and the corresponding global topic-word distributions
elements.2211.03616_03039c4cea2a35ea9a6c3c579c873: The other is a topic-guided VQ-VAE codebook, where we align its latent codes/embeddings with the topic embeddings jointly learned by an NTM throughout the training phase.
elements.2211.03616_319bcaafe04966baf5d4062d93483: We further incorporate the quantized sentence representations learned by our topic-enhanced VQ-VAE into transformer-based language models to guide the learning of contextual embeddings
elements.2211.03616_426420fbff9f273b687ecc83f345d: Built on top of the multi-head attention, a semantics-driven attention mechanism is proposed to compute the attention scores based on the quantized sentence representations
elements.2211.03616_a64cd258bc538ec92be264a886de1: The proposed attention mechanism is a flexible plug-and-play module that requires a small number of extra parameters and a minimum change to the existing multi-head attention implementation.
elements.2211.03616_78889fa8732b10ed205c6301372ea: To the best of our knowledge, this is the first language model that explores the use of discrete latent variables learned by VQ-VAE for STS.
elements.2211.03616_ac4fc9b68319bc8aa0ca739d61d94: We introduce a topic-enhanced VQ-VAE model that combines the merits of topic modeling and vector quantization, where the quantization is informed by the topic information jointly learned by an NTM to enhance its robustness against the collapsing problem and its capacity of capturing both the global and local semantics.
elements.2211.03616_e095eb6d4236e012ac4a9426a342c: We present a simple yet effective semantics-driven attention mechanism to inject the quantized representations into transformer models, which can serve as a plug-and-play module for almost all the existing transformer-based models.
elements.2211.03616_d116cd521b9a1b1b968464775dd9a: Comprehensive experiments on six real-world datasets for semantic textual matching demonstrate the effectiveness of our model and the significance of its major components.
elements.2211.03616_7c997ad1eeae949f118986fcf0d06: Neural language models have played a key role in fulfilling the STS task
elements.2211.03616_aaf4ad0bcd59f4b4a0293d1931e80: Among them, the earlier CNN-based model
elements.2211.03616_9a46f2d9b011c575ca1d49b1b72da: used to achieve the state-of-the-art performance
elements.2211.03616_3095012cb3cc5829d1b617f756c11: before the emergence of the transformer architecture
elements.2211.03616_2b96c4a7cb4b9bfef11e939b42ae2: and the large-scale pre-training of its corresponding models
elements.2211.03616_0470de16f42242e25687e0e3fdf7c: These pre-trained models, with their ability to be fine-tuned on various domains and tasks, have dominated the entire NLP area, significantly improving the task performance in the specific domains
elements.2211.03616_23831d8ab3c16931b8cd4f21eb79f: As the most prominent model, BERT
elements.2211.03616_7ada992c394483b83ec0bfc5ab5ac: , along with its variants including RoBERTa
elements.2211.03616_1335553b91390748b7358e0ff21d6: , have achieved superior results in the STS task
elements.2211.03616_c73478ab57574437d56057869f825: Despite the achieved success, current language models are mostly
elements.2211.03616_9eae049a5d75ffef4d627db7f264c: models with low interpretability, which require additional explanatory components for their predictions in needed fields such as Biomedicine and Finance.
elements.2211.03616_ee2435bc11407692b5c4c00d679b1: has led to the development of a series of neural topic models (NTM)
elements.2211.03616_3fae72f01c2c9b8c679b1b5c5e34c: ) for a comprehensive survey on NTMs), where the posterior distribution of document topics is approximated by a neural network during the variational inference process, known as the neural variational inference (NVI)
elements.2211.03616_de413c04d65635bd554301d59bedb: The NVI also enables NTMs to be easily combined with various language models for capturing the global semantics information
elements.2211.03616_71a7a8d99b211dd03d8e06fbf4ac9: These hybrid models are known as the topic-aware language models
elements.2211.03616_6c07793b2c5e6772bd0d76cce6acd: Their combination strategies can be largely characterized by either concatenation of (document) topic distributions with the local word embeddings, or (multi-head) attention mechanisms towards the inferred topics
elements.2211.03616_96e2590f5a6a54e902c9003323761: These models have been shown to achieve higher performance than the plain language models on various tasks, such as text summarization
elements.2211.03616_6a5794c05fede24db72f2ef9aae7b: Rather than learning continuous representations, VQ-VAE
elements.2211.03616_4153114f08f818610d50447ec2c1c: learns quantized representations via vector quantization
elements.2211.03616_08caabb4cda230ecb03aae4176d71: It was first applied to speech representation
elements.2211.03616_82263d263de3d398722bce9510809: Recently, it has attracted lots of attention in a variety of NLP tasks
elements.2211.03616_f22fc05a99b0419ac9d2c58566bcc: ) applied VQ-VAE to decode the target language sequence from the discrete space, making the model inference faster and the model performance only slightly compromised
elements.2211.03616_9bf586cf4eed7d4af6baaa2db7605: ) explored general text representations induced by VQ-VAE for the classification especially in low-resource domains.
elements.2211.03616_1631c527a6618c8272556ff113938: ) designed a semi-supervised VQ-VAE for new event type induction, while
elements.2211.03616_12c4c5c1abf3d38de3e60041d1be8: ) equipped the encode-decoder architecture with the VQ-VAE to automatically select relevant evidence
elements.2211.03616_ffe11d3f91ce15c5b655153bcd51f: In this paper, we move one step further by guiding the vector quantization with topics learned by NTMs.

elements.2211.03616_04b7284da46f02506e4d7c7cedb4a: We conducted experiments on the following benchmark datasets used for the STS task, which include MRPC, Quora, STS-B, and SemEval CQA.

elements.2211.03616_49f4ff1fc2bccf6ba2f14baaa7eed: Meanwhile, when the output is equipped with quantized representations, performance is significantly improved, which further verifies that the learned topic-informed discrete latent variable can capture semantics and improve the STS

elements.2211.03616_b7159e1d81475f15fea26742ea1aa: After we pretrained the NTM, there are two ways of training our topic-enhanced VQ-VAE
elements.2211.03616_8a766ff64b89a8aab182863ef4f1a: One is to utilize the topic embeddings from the pretrained NTM as the codebook initialization in VQ-VAE and train the latter while holding the former fixed (denoted by
elements.2211.03616_a2fcd83d403c48f3600206a323096: ), the other is to joint train the pretrained NTM and VQ-VAE (denoted by
elements.2211.03616_9c10c15621f7196dd810a49ac9c38: The results of these two training methods derived from the six STS datasets are shown in Table
elements.2211.03616_4b56fa7fc361dc1ae677db71ad7f4: We can see that compared with multistage training, joint training yields better results on all datasets for both DisBert and DisRoBERTa
elements.2211.03616_3d0bedbd39c6fb248ca561bbe3992: The comparison shows that jointly training the topic embedding matrix
elements.2211.03616_f9ec772a8ae4dd25df56f094fe63a: , we compared the results of Bert and DisBert with different training data
elements.2211.03616_50b4089a6b2013c9b7b18c757a2e4: data from the training set as training data
elements.2211.03616_a291960607fc69918b106604d4454: We can observe that DisBert outperforms Bert consistently across all training data sizes, which suggests that we can leverage the topic-enhanced discrete variable in all data sizes, even when the training data is scarce.
elements.2211.03616_cbcd1d8f6d6f6fa7c0ced6f1c2452: shows the performance of DisBert given varying topic numbers
elements.2211.03616_8de554d28d13f6c091234410f4e54: As we can see, the curves on all datasets are not monotonic and the best accuracy is achieved with different numbers of topics, e.g.,
elements.2211.03616_568bb4da02fa8e2764d4d41d7689b: We also found that on larger training datasets DisBert requires larger topic numbers and vice versa, e.g.,
elements.2211.03616_1be677c28afffb6dfaef5389f11af: for SemEval-B. It is not unexpected, as larger datasets can cover more topics
elements.2211.03616_a8f14f93c3218aac6fbaa05525d31: However, how to let the data choose the right number of topics in NTM is beyond the scope of this paper.
elements.2211.03616_2eed4accb38634fa80525ef26ef2a: shows the effect of semantics-driven multi-head attention on different layers
elements.2211.03616_600ea01ae901372e7193320f3dfb1: We found that the aforesaid attention is not always helpful for all layers and best performances are achieved when applying such attention to the last layer of DisBert/DisRoBERTa on MRPC datasets
elements.2211.03616_77417ffa9f4bb9c7082a71e53cfd1: Meanwhile, the performance drops when such attention is applied to all layers.
elements.2211.03616_5b43bcbaa82f773c0d8968b31acb6: , we conduct a case study on STS-B datasets to show how the model works with topical information
elements.2211.03616_cb02394490176f3ad70292cbd8660: The left part of the table shows four word clusters generated by Topic-enhanced VQ-VAE
elements.2211.03616_918725c489d6417f57a5f6ab8645f: , the topic-enhanced VQ-VAE model clusters words in the discrete space given by the codebook
elements.2211.03616_a0d80e045803f2aea632c5092a589: It can be seen that words in the same cluster form a meaningful topic: Cluster 7 is about protest, Cluster 6 is about transportation, Cluster 20 is about government election, and Cluster 26 is one of the clusters capturing all the functional words
elements.2211.03616_a38f69a4fa2d16839015eee16169a: The right part of the table shows two pairs of sentences used in the STS tasks with the assignments of the four topics to their words
elements.2211.03616_6f74051d42103e1a157ea15fd28c5: We can observe that sentences, which are predicted to be similar by our model, tend to have more words assigned to similar topics, even if those words are morphologically different
elements.2211.03616_d9bddea55850a7d0b6d9821bdea4e: The heat map calculated by semantics-driven multi-head attention is shown on Appendix
elements.2211.03616_c52ba7b7c6c8f90cb47d0d9eaaad5: we developed a topic-enhanced VQ-VAE model to effectively train discrete latent variables by informing the vector quantization with semantics (i.e., latent topics) learned from a broader context by a neural topic model
elements.2211.03616_6e09e3ade12b0bc63154a8f8d98bd: Then we further designed a semantics-driven multi-head attention mechanism for enriching the contextual embeddings learned by Transformer with topical information, which is calculated based on the quantized representations from topic-enhanced VQ-VAE
elements.2211.03616_a0e63eddff16790c4b008d5fd5f9d: Its plug-and-play characteristic allows it to be readily incorporated into various transformed-based language models
elements.2211.03616_9fa8925535921feca039b38fb484c: Through experiments on different scale datasets for the STS task, we proved that building the semantic information learned by NTM via vector quantization into the multi-head attention block can improve the STS performance of transformer-based language models.
elements.2211.03616_b9ca99015a540acee93652b0975fd: The limitations of this work, to the best of our knowledge, can be summarized into two aspects: (1) Compared to the origin Bert/RoBERTa, our model DisBert/DisRoBERTa needs a longer time to train since there are three components in our framework, i.e., topic model, VQ-VAE model, and the transformer-based model
elements.2211.03616_cb713a543848b628b09a7db54475f: , we can observe that in a small dataset like MRPC and STS-B, the training time is almost three times longer
elements.2211.03616_6c71d235a0089aabebfc4deccff33: While in the large datasets Quora, our model took an extra 2.5 hours
elements.2211.03616_7cc9d69af8989b123749a9a86a588: Therefore in future work, we need to improve the efficiency of our model. (2) The improvement of our method is limited when sentences are long enough or training datasets are large, e.g., Quora and SemEvalC shown in table
elements.2211.03616_61dbd776c5a94219cfbe3512dfa87: Our model is capable of complete global semantics, hence it works better for small datasets and short sentences which contain limited semantics.
elements.2211.03616_10ec984548c971ab61c5cce62c8a8: This work is supported by the National Natural Science Foundation of China (No.61976102 and No.U19A2065) and the Science and Technology Development Program of Jilin Province (No.20210508060RQ), and the Fundamental Research Funds for the Central Universities, JLU.
elements.2211.03616_6be0d1a35162704455ab18eab4b04: Labels indicate if the second sentence is a paraphrase (for paraphrasing tasks) or relevant (for QA tasks)
elements.2211.03616_84342b3e49f7f594b398c7be83c8d: In STS-B datasets, the label stands for sentence pair similarity score, and the higher score, the more similar the two sentences are.

elements.2211.03616_ab4238a7442d3534f3efecb11840a: shows the hyperparameter we chose in our model
elements.2211.03616_8853b4a404ce823a181d4fe5fc5b5: All hyper-parameters were chosen through greedy search based on development set performance
elements.2211.03616_4b034e5993ec76f0b6b4eea6e52b3: For topic model, we choose number of topics in (20, 30, 40, 50, 60, 70, 80, 90, 100, 150, 200), batch size in (128, 256, 512), and learning rate in (1e-3, 2e-3, 3e-3)
elements.2211.03616_0adec618adc82d48b4c9c69b85f28: For the VQ-VAE model, we choose the batch size in (32, 64, 128), and the learning rate in (2e-5, 3e-5)
elements.2211.03616_754ef70e7fc7b85acb1b64066f30e: For the Bert model, We choose the batch size in (32, 64, 128), and the learning rate in (2e-5, 3e-5).

elements.2211.03616_9dd4c954e3e339cadfb2f8b2c5385: shows the heat map of sentence pair 1 in the case study, which is calculated by our semantics-driven multi-head attention
elements.2211.03616_2711f02e3f47f63241cc4a303880e: We can observe that words from the same cluster usually pay high attention to each other because they correspond to the same hidden vector in the codebook
elements.2211.03616_684f090fbc9012ed95639f82f8e0b: Such attention could help Bert model focus on the words which may have similar semantics.
